public delegate void ProgressChangedEventHandler(object sender, ProgressChangedEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed ProgressChangedEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub ProgressChangedEventHandler(sender As Object, e As ProgressChangedEventArgs)
type ProgressChangedEventHandler = delegate of obj * ProgressChangedEventArgs -> unit
public delegate void ProgressChangedEventHandler(object? sender, ProgressChangedEventArgs e);

Docs.param: A that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event of the class. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you create a <xref:System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventHandler> delegate, you identify a method to handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about event handler delegates, see [Handling and Raising Events](/dotnet/standard/events/).
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventHandler> class. This example is part of a larger example for the <xref:System.ComponentModel.BackgroundWorker> class.
:::code language="cpp" source="~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.ComponentModel.BackgroundWorker/CPP/fibonacciform.cpp" id="Snippet7"::: :::code language="csharp" source="~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.ComponentModel.BackgroundWorker/CS/fibonacciform.cs" id="Snippet7"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.ComponentModel.BackgroundWorker/VB/fibonacciform.vb" id="Snippet7":::
